TopicTitle: Why doesn't the estimated burn time ever show up for me?

Articles.Content: Lately when I have been playing and I go to plan a maneuver I used to remember it showing me the burn time so I knew if I was doing it right or wrong. But now where the number should be is blank right up until I turn the engines on and then find out I set myself up with a three minute burn and abort. It has been a long time since I started playing again but I am not sure if it's a setting or something I need to go before hand to get it to show up correctly. Normally by the time I get into a correct orbit to move out to the mun I am on my last stage anyway because I still have problems with wasting fuel on the way up.

If your staging to a less powerful engine, the system won't recalculate until you have fired those engines at least once. What happens is the maneuver node is calculated using the engines you discarded, not the engines you have now. If the discarded engines were powerful enough, the calculation may have been less than a second resulting in no burn time shown.
Mine never shows an estimated burn time. Even after burning the engines and burning them on a maneuver node (to satisfaction of the node). Never. Mac OS.

KerikBalm,

As far as I know, what you're seeing is normal behavior for KSP on all platforms. It won't show a good estimate until you burn the engines in the current stage for a few moments. This is true after staging or loading a save.

tater's reporting that the burn time never appears.
Mechjeb has a hidden readout (ie, you need to customize a window) that shows accurate burn times. It won't work if you're staging during the burn, but if you aren't, it works.

You can always estimate things yourself. Thrust to mass ratio in kN/tonne equals acceleration in m/s^2. Get thrust by totting up your engines and mass from the info panel on the map screen. Burn duration is delta-V divided by acceleration.

It'll be an overestimate because you're using up fuel, but for most manoeuvres it doesn't matter much and anyway this is how the game's predictor does it.
